etymology.interpretation: 过敏(過敏) (guòmǐn, "be allergic") consists of 过(過) (guò, "exceed") and 敏(敏) (mǐn, "sensitive"), implying a reaction where the sensitivity of the body exceeds a normal level. Hence, it describes an allergic reaction where the body's response to certain stimuli is excessively sensitive.

examples.chinese: 我很容易过敏(我很容易過敏)。
我对花粉过敏(我對花粉過敏)，每到春天就打喷嚏(每到春天就打噴嚏)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ duì huāfěn guòmǐn, měi dào chūntiān jiù dǎ pēntì.
examples.english: I am allergic to pollen, and I sneeze every spring.

examples.chinese: 出门前他总会检查食物(出門前他總會檢查食物)，以防过敏(以防過敏)。
examples.pinyin: Chūmén qián tā zǒng huì jiǎnchá shíwù, yǐ fáng guòmǐn.
examples.english: Before going out, he always checks his food to prevent allergic reactions.
